titleInfo.title: Jackson County Bible and Family Records

mods.identifier: Jackson County Bible and Family Records 976.87
mods.abstract: Typed manuscript of "Jackson County Family History of Pendleton, Broaddus, Gaines. Copied by Maude McGlasson, 1936." Part of WPA records. During the 1930s and early 40s, the Works Progress/Projects Administration (WPA) created by Franklin D. Roosevelt included the Historical Records Survey which hired workers whose work primarily focused on locating, arranging, and cataloging historical records as well as transcribing, photographing, or otherwise preserving those in danger of destruction.
